title: Typefaces used in Climb On! catalogue
content:
Hi, does anyone know the typefaces (2x) in this cluster of type?  
I have to do a re-interpretation of a flyer using the same type as their catalogue.  
Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035521im_/http:/typophile.com/files/various_type_5232.png)

 [‹ (x) New York Magazine title - Miller Headline {Marc O}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035521/http:/typophile.com/node/32369 "Go to previous forum topic") [Benetton logo geometric sans ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035521/http:/typophile.com/node/32433 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Seadreams

comments.content: Got one of them (top left) is ICG Improv, can anyone tell me if this is a free typeface or alternatively a typeface that is very similar for free? Thanks.

you poor bugger, those are some shiitty fonts!

Muzz
Haha! Yep, it’s going to be pretty painful working with these beauties!

[Improv](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035521/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/imageclub/improv/) is not free font and, since Agfa/MT took the ICG fonts over, they’ve been rather pricy.

I can’t think of anything free like Improv. You can do a search by Theme (style, really) on Dafont from the link to Flowerchild above to see if something free there is acceptably close.

I’d suggest [Postino](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035521/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/postino/) (actually a backslanted Postino Italic would be even closer) as a cheaper commercial alternative.

You can always rely on Muzzer to tell it like it is :^)

Nick Cooke

You could also look at some of [Nick Curtis’s old freebies](http://web.archive.org/web/20080603035521/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/curtis/pages/u_z.htm) for a possible Improv alternative. It has the kind of ’retro’ vibe that many of his fonts also have.

- Mike Yanega
